message.content:
Step 1. Calculate Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio  
• From the cash flow statement, the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities is –17,417,367.15.  
• From the income statement, the Net Profit is 405,999.64.  
• Ratio = (Operating Cash Flow) / (Net Profit) = –17,417,367.15 / 405,999.64 ≈ –42.91  

Step 2. Calculate the Current Assets Turnover Ratio  
• “Total Current Assets” at the beginning is 20,000,000.00 and at the end is 21,224,639.20.  
• The average current assets = (20,000,000.00 + 21,224,639.20) / 2 = 20,612,319.60  
• From the income statement, the Main Business Revenue (or Total Revenue) is 14,542,813.42.  
• Ratio = Total Revenue / Average Current Assets = 14,542,813.42 / 20,612,319.60 ≈ 0.71  

Step 3. Calculate the Quick Ratio  
• Quick Assets include Cash on Hand, Bank Deposits, Interest Receivable, and Accounts Receivable.  
 – Cash on Hand: 1,482,632.85  
 – Bank Deposits: 1,100,000.00  
 – Interest Receivable: 20,559.00  
 – Accounts Receivable: 10,221,447.35  
  Total Quick Assets = 1,482,632.85 + 1,100,000.00 + 20,559.00 + 10,221,447.35 = 12,824,639.20  
• Current Liabilities (end) are given by Taxes Payable = 727,140.68 (Accounts Payable is 0).  
• Quick Ratio = Quick Assets / Current Liabilities = 12,824,639.20 / 727,140.68 ≈ 17.63  

Thus, the solution is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "-42.91",
    "Current Assets Turnover Ratio": "0.71",
    "Quick Ratio": "17.63"
  }
}
